        Creates a new METRO Game.

      • create

        public void create()
        Specified by:
        create in interface com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener

      • detectOS

        private void detectOS()
        Detects the current operating system and saves it.

      • initGdx

        private void initGdx()
        Initializes the gdx system by creating a sprite batch, a camera and an input processor.

      • loadVisuals

        private void loadVisuals()
        Loads everything that has to do with visual things like textures and also the fonts. This method loads all textures including main menu button, title image, icon set and cursor image. It also creates the two default colors __metroBlue and __metroRed.

      • loadCursorImage

        private void loadCursorImage()
        Loads the cursor image based on the operating system (setting default cursor doesn't work in windows -> loading the cursor as texture).

      • loadFonts

        private com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont loadFonts()
        Load the font GatsbyFLF-Bold in size 21.

      • initWindowStuff

        private void initWindowStuff()
        Creates the list of all windows and the default observer (_windowObserver) that removes a closed window from this list. The default observer is an anonymous class, because of java 7 I don't use a lambda in this case.

      • resize

        public void resize(int width,
          int height)
        Specified by:
        resize in interface com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener

      • render

        public void render()
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener

      • renderWindowTitleBar

        private void renderWindowTitleBar()
        Draws the title bar including the close cross and the blue border around the window. This method uses the _titleBarHeight and _titleBarBorderLineWidth variables.

      • calculateMousePosition

        private void calculateMousePosition()
        Calculates the mouse position concerning fullscreen, window borders, windows, etc. When the mouse is in a window, the position does not change (to prevent wrong clicks on other controls/tools).

      • renderInit

        private void renderInit()
        Initializes the rendering by clearing the screen and updating the control list.

      • updateActionManagerList

        private void updateActionManagerList()

      • renderCurrentGameScreen

        private void renderCurrentGameScreen()
        Updates the game screen and draws the control drawer.

      • renderWindows

        private void renderWindows()
        Draws all windows that are in the __windowList.

      • renderFPSDisplay

        private void renderFPSDisplay()
        Draws the FPS-display with the frames per second given by Gdx.

      • renderCursor

        private void renderCursor()
        Draws the cursor based on the operating system (if windows: cursor is drawn manually).

      • touchDown

        public boolean touchDown(int screenX,
                int screenY,
                int pointer,
                int button)
        Is executed when the user clicks with the mouse. This method will forward the click event to the right control, window or game screen. The exact hierarchy is shown below. The click-hierarchy: 1.) Check if the mouse is in a window If yes: Forward click to this window and remind it If no : Go to next window. screenX -= 1; screenY -= 20; 2.) Forward click to ControlActionManager with the clicked window as parameter 3.) Check if the clicked window is null (=there has no window been clicked) If yes: Close the window if needed If no : Forward click to game screen
        Specified by:
        touchDown in interface com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor

      • touchUp

        public boolean touchUp(int screenX,
              int screenY,
              int pointer,
              int button)
        Specified by:
        touchUp in interface com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor

      • touchDragged

        public boolean touchDragged(int screenX,
                   int screenY,
                   int pointer)
        Specified by:
        touchDragged in interface com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener

      • __unregisterControl

        public static void __unregisterControl(ControlElement control)
        Removes a control from the control action manager to disable user interactions with it. Notice: Don't use this from a game screen there's the method "unregisterControl(ControlElement control)" in the GameScreen class!
        Parameters:
        control - The control to remove.

      • __registerWindow

        public static void __registerWindow(Window window)
        Adds the window to the list of all windows so that it'll get click- or scroll-events. This method also adds the _windowObserver to the window so that it'll be closed correctly. There are no doubles allowed in this list, so a second call with the same window won#t add it.
        Parameters:
        window - The window that should be added to the list of all windows.

      • __changeGameScreen

        public static void __changeGameScreen(GameScreen newScreen)
        Closes the current game screen and makes the given screen to the new one.
        Parameters:
        newScreen - The new game screen.

      • __setSelectedInput

        public static void __setSelectedInput(InputField field)
        Sets the selected input of the current game screen. This enables to change the focus of the input fields.
        Parameters:
        field - The input field that should get the focus.

      • __debug

        public static void __debug(java.lang.String message)
        Prints a debug message into the console but only if the debug mode is on.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to print.

      • __debug

        public static void __debug(java.lang.String message,
           int stackCounter)
        Prints a debug message into the console but only if the debug mode is on.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to print.
        stackCounter - The counter for the stack trace to print the right line number (and not something like metro.METRO.__debug(METRO.java:650) :/

      • setSettings

        private void setSettings()
        Reads the settings from the settings.cfg and sets them to the variables of METRO.

      • __getXOffset

        public static int __getXOffset()
        Returns:
        The x-offset of the normal drawing canvas (everything excluding the window border)

      • __getYOffset

        public static int __getYOffset()
        Returns:
        The y-offset of the normal drawing canvas (everything excluding the window border)

      • __exit

        public static void __exit()
        Closes the game window and exits the application. This method wont ask the user to confirm or anything like that.
